definition: to practice fraud/to cheat/to engage in corrupt practices
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works

sentences.english: That makes it tough for Sisson to cheat, which she says is a "good thing."
sentences.chinese: 這使得西森難有機會作弊，但她認爲這是件好事情。

sentences.english: Koreans all cheat and plagiarize in universities.
sentences.chinese: 韓國人在大學裏沒幾個不作弊和剽竊。

sentences.english: They lie and cheat and send young Americans to their death solely for their own profit.
sentences.chinese: 他們爲了自己的利益扯謊作弊，讓美國年輕人去送死。

sentences.english: In school teach him it is far more honourable to fail than to cheat.
sentences.chinese: 教他求學時不及格比作弊來得剛正。

sentences.english: I despaired, but I did not give up. Instead, I cheated.
sentences.chinese: 我失望了，但是沒有放棄，而是作弊了。

sentences.english: It can't be worse, Bill, cheating again in the make-up exam.
sentences.chinese: 沒什麼比這更糟的了，比爾，在補考的時候又作弊。
遞補選舉看起來作弊了。

sentences.english: I would rather fail than tricking in the examination.
sentences.chinese: 我寧肯考試通不過也不願作弊。

sentences.english: Paul tried to cheat on his test by sneaking in a crib card.
sentences.chinese: 保羅想在考試中夾帶小抄作弊。

sentences.english: In spite of my wonderful cheating techniques, I flunck math.
sentences.chinese: 雖然我有美妙的作弊技巧，我的數學還是被當掉了。

sentences.english: They are considering ways to personalize the exams to minimize cheating.
sentences.chinese: 他們也在考慮提供個性化考試來減少作弊。

sentences.english: Cheating on the diet—such as eating a candy bar—can bring on a seizure in minutes.
sentences.chinese: 在飲食上作弊，比如喫塊方糖，會馬上引起癲癇發作。

sentences.english: It was found later after a check that the Chinese students might have cheated in the French language quiz before going to France.
sentences.chinese: 檢查後發現，中國學生赴法語文測驗可能有作弊行爲。

sentences.english: Jiang Mou uses civilian battalion express delivery in Nanning, sent cogged material to Liang Mou.
sentences.chinese: 蔣某則在南寧用民營快遞，給梁某寄去了作弊器材。

sentences.english: She spent her last years joining street protests calling for the resignation of President Gloria Macapagal Arroyo, who was widely accused of rigging her 2004 election.
sentences.chinese: 這位總統被廣泛的指控在2004年的競選中作弊。

definition: to take a test or exam for sb
to abuse one's position for personal gain (idiom)
to assume sb's name and take his place (idiom); to impersonate/to pose under a false name
covert activities (election rigging etc)/under-the-table manipulations/black operations
lack of discipline/to break a rule/to violate discipline/to breach a principle
to get away with it/to slip through/to bluff one's way out/Taiwan pr. [meng1 hun4 guo4 guan1]
to counterfeit/to falsify/to cheat/to defraud/fraudulent/to behave affectedly
